skills.name: Identify equivalent fractions when presented as shapes or objects
Identify equivalent fractions when presented as numbers

explanations.A: We can look at the fraction of each shape that is shaded. Are they equivalent fractions?
explanations.B: We can look at the fraction of each shape that is shaded. Are they equivalent fractions?
explanations.C: Shape P has 6/12 parts shaded and Shape Q has 2/4 parts shaded. Both fractions simplify to 1/2.
explanations.D: We can look at the fraction of each shape that is shaded. Are they equivalent fractions?

explanations.A: We can look at the fraction of each shape that is shaded. Are they equivalent fractions?
explanations.B: We can look at the fraction of each shape that is shaded. Are they equivalent fractions?
explanations.C: Shape P has 9/12 parts shaded. Shape Q has 3/4 parts shaded. 9/12 is equivalent to 3/4, so they have the same proportion shaded.
explanations.D: We can look at the fraction of each shape that is shaded. Are they equivalent fractions?

explanations.A: We can look at the fraction of each shape that is shaded. Are they equivalent fractions?
explanations.B: We can look at the fraction of each shape that is shaded. Are they equivalent fractions?
explanations.C: Shape P has 4/16 parts shaded. Shape Q has 1/4 parts shaded. They are equivalent fractions. Therefore, the same proportion is shaded.
explanations.D: We can look at the fraction of each shape that is shaded. Are they equivalent fractions?

explanations.A: Shape P has 8/16 parts shaded. Shape Q has 1/4 parts shaded. 8/16 is equivalent to 2/4, not 1/4, so they do not have the same proportion shaded. Shape P has a greater proportion shaded.
explanations.B: We can look at the fraction of each shape that is shaded. Are they equivalent fractions?
explanations.C: We can look at the fraction of each shape that is shaded. Are they equivalent fractions?
explanations.D: We can look at the fraction of each shape that is shaded. Are they equivalent fractions?

explanations.A: 1/4 is shown in the first diagram and 3/12 is shown in the second. The images are the same size showing that 1/4 is equivalent to 3/12
explanations.B: 1/4 is larger than 1/12 but look at the purple parts, what do you notice about their sizes? Therefore what can you say about 1/4 and 3/12?
explanations.C: I think you are saying 1/4 is less than 3/12 because it is only 1 piece and the other is 3 pieces but we need to look at the size not the number of pieces. What do you notice about the sizes?
explanations.D: It is one of the above... Look at the sizes of the purple pieces, what do you notice about them? Therefore what can you conclude about 1/4 and 3/12?

explanations.A: 1/3 is larger than 1/9 but look at the yellow parts, what do you notice about their sizes? Therefore what can you say about 1/3 and 3/9?
explanations.B: I think you are saying 1/3 is less than 3/9 because it is only 1 piece and the other is 3 pieces but we need to look at the size not the number of pieces. What do you notice about the sizes?
explanations.C: 1/3 is shown in the first diagram and 3/9 is shown in the second. The images are the same size showing that 1/3 is equivalent to 3/9
explanations.D: It is one of the above... Look at the sizes of the yellow pieces, what do you notice about them? Therefore what can you conclude about 1/3 and 3/9?

explanations.A: We are looking for a diagram where the wholes are the same size and the size of the purple parts are too. Can you spot it?!
explanations.B: We are looking for a diagram where the wholes are the same size and the size of the purple parts are too. Can you spot it?!
explanations.C: The first diagram shows 3/5 and the second 6/10. The wholes are the same size and the size of the purple parts are too therefore this diagram shows 3/5 = 6/10.
explanations.D: We are looking for a diagram where the wholes are the same size and the size of the purple parts are too. Can you spot it?!

explanations.A: We are looking for a diagram where the wholes are the same size and the size of the purple parts are too. Can you spot it?!
explanations.B: We are looking for a diagram where the wholes are the same size and the size of the purple parts are too. Can you spot it?!
explanations.C: We are looking for a diagram where the wholes are the same size and the size of the purple parts are too. Can you spot it?!
explanations.D: The first diagram shows 2/5 and the second 4/10. The wholes are the same size and the size of the purple parts are too therefore this diagram shows 2/5 = 4/10.

explanations.A: This is incorrect because when finding equivalent fractions you can multiply OR divide the numerator and denominator by the same value. Re-read the question to decide who is correct!
explanations.B: This is incorrect because when finding equivalent fractions you can multiply OR divide the numerator and denominator by the same value. Re-read the question to decide who is correct!
explanations.C: When finding equivalent fractions you can multiply OR divide the numerator and denominator by the same value therefore both Tom and Katie are correct because 1/4 x 2/2 = 2/8 and 2/8 รท 2/2 = 1/4
explanations.D: To find equivalent fractions you can multiply OR divide the numerator and denominator by the same value. Now you have this information, re-read the question to decide who is correct!

explanations.A: This is incorrect because when finding equivalent fractions you can multiply OR divide the numerator and denominator by the same value. Re-read the question to decide who is correct!
explanations.B: This is incorrect because when finding equivalent fractions you can multiply OR divide the numerator and denominator by the same value. Re-read the question to decide who is correct!
explanations.C: When finding equivalent fractions you can multiply OR divide the numerator and denominator by the same value therefore both Tom and Katie are correct because 3/5 x 2/2 = 6/10 and 6/10 รท 2/2 = 3/5
explanations.D: To find equivalent fractions you can multiply OR divide the numerator and denominator by the same value. Now you have this information, re-read the question to decide who is correct!
